oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tall Tales - #?? - 'The Strange Death Of Meriwether Lewis'
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM program Tall Tales, episode number unknown. Featuring the tale 'The Strange Death of Meriwether Lewis', written by Bill Woolsey, read by Bobby Wiener, produced by Marjorie Cooney, with ballad singer George Grise. An excerpt of this episode is used in WSM program 'Variety Award Presentation' (January 21, 1954 - see TR001250_2 ), dating this episode as 1953, contrary to the announcement that the following week's Tall Tales program is titled 'The Day The Earth Trembled', as this evidently aired June 1, 1954 (see TR001565_1 ).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: George Grise
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: On Top Of Old Smoky (George Grise) -- Opening statement (Bobby Wiener) -- 'The Strange Death Of Meriwether Lewis' (Bobby Wiener, cast) -- Oh Shenandoah (George Grise) -- 'The Strange Death Of Meriwether Lewis' (Bobby Wiener, cast) -- On Top Of Old Smoky (George Grise) -- Announcer closing statement
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Tall tales (Radio program); Woolsey, Bill; Grise, George O.; Cooney, Marjorie
